description.narrative: Humanitarian Acute Crisis Joint Response to cyclone IDAI affected people in Mozambique and Malawi - a consortium of 6 Dutch organisations, under the Dutch Relief Alliance (DRA), led by Oxfam

title.narrative: Number of crisis-affected people who are also involved in the design, implementation, montoring and/or evaluation of the programme

comment.narrative: Number of crisis-affected people who are also involved in the design, implementation, montoring and/or evaluation of the programme

Part of the hygiene promotion and NFI beneficiaries
ZERO to avoid double counting
Number of boys and girls not captured during this period. Will be included in the community evaluation consultations.

Part of the hygiene promotion and NFI beneficiaries

Part of the hygiene promotion and NFI beneficiaries
ZERO to avoid double counting
Number of boys and girls not captured during this period. Will be included in the community evaluation consultations. As a rule of thumb, before starting any activity at district or community level, involvement and participation of community leaders and government is key. Community consultations were therefore done prior to implementation of project activities in order to get their involvement, participation and support. Project beneficiaries were also informed about different types of feedback mechanisms available for their use, before starting any activity. During the life of the project 3 complaints were received and recorded through the Linha Verde (toll-free hotline) platform, regarding water supply challenges in the resettlement camp. This resulted in the field team moving-in quickly to resolve the problem.
Before any distribution or activity FH first consults and meets with the community leadership to inform about the planned activity and who are the beneficiaries and deliverables. FH also informs the leadership about the different feedback/complaint mechanisms available for their use. In each community, the leadership is comprised of one community leader, one church leader, chief of four houses and Government representative and 50% are women. On beneficiary registration, FH received the lists from the Government and verify to confirm that those on the list are the right ones to benefit.

This resulted in the field team moving-in quickly to resolve the problem.
Before any distribution or activity FH first consults and meets with the community leadership to inform about the planned activity and who are the beneficiaries and deliverables. FH also informs the leadership about the different feedback/complaint mechanisms available for their use. In each community, the leadership is comprised of one community leader, one church leader, chief of four houses and Government representative and 50% are women. On beneficiary registration, FH received the lists from the Government and verify to confirm that those on the list are the right ones to benefit.

title.narrative: Number of people having access to dignified, safe, clean and functional excreta disposal facilities

comment.narrative: Number of people having access to dignified, safe, clean and functional excreta disposal facilities

The focus for latrine construction were in schools and some household latrines in Savane resettlement camp. 14 blocks of latrines were constructed in 4 schools in Nhamatanda district. These latrines are benefitting a total of 5012 school children and 98 teachers in the 4 schools.The project also constructed 116 household latrines in Savane resettlement camp of Dondo district. FH has been leading WASH interventions in the camp. However, due to budget constraints FH could not construct latrines for all the 267HHs that occupy the camp. Only the most vulnerable were selected and benefitted from this activity. The focus for latrine construction were in schools and some household latrines in Savane resettlement camp. In total FH constructed 14 blocks of latrines in four schools in Nhamatanda and 116 household latrines in Savane resettlement camp. FH is leading all WASH activities in the resettlement camp (Dondo district). However, due to budgetary constraints FH couldnt afford to constrruct for all the 267 families living there. The remainder was targeted by another grant.

title.narrative: Number of people having access to sufficient and safe water for domestic use

comment.narrative: Number of people having access to sufficient and safe water for domestic use

FH has been supporting communities providing water through water purification systems installed in Schools, communities and resettlement camp and also through water points rehabilitated. In total FH rehabilitated 17 water points, 5 in Nhamatanda, 2 in Beira and 10 in Dondo.
In the beginning FH provided trucked water for domestic use at the IDP camps. With the support of Water Mission FH was able to install improved technology water purification systems in four communities (two in Savane resettlement camp and two schools) and also drilled a borehole and installed an electric pump to sustain the system which is more efficient and guarantees water with good quality over a long period in all the sites.

title.narrative: Number of people having regular access to soap to meet hygienic needs

comment.narrative: Number of people having regular access to soap to meet hygienic needs
The total amount reached here is cumulative based on first and second hygiene kit distribution which included two bars of soap, vaseline, toothpaste and dignity pads for women.

title.narrative: Number of people reached with hygiene promotion/awareness raising activities

comment.narrative: Number of people reached with hygiene promotion/awareness raising activities

Same beneficiaries who received NFIs and water supply intervention.
32 water and sanitation committes were formed in all the sites that project did some water point rehabilitations and intallations of water systems. The project managed to provide IEC material to bring awareness to communities on hygiene and sanitation promotion. Information on hygiene promotion was also provided during distributions of hygiene and dignity kits. Door to door campaigns were also conducted through water and sanitation committees.
